turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Mrs. Brovlofski, the V-chip hasn't been fully tested yet, it could be dangerous.

turns.speaker: KYLE'S MOTHER
turns.text: I don't care if it's dangerous! Desperate times call for desperate measures, Mr. Mackey. Perhaps I need to remind you of your situation.

turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Alright, I'll make the call...

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: What?! Why would you call me a pigfucker?!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Well, let's see... First of all, you fuck pigs.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Oh yeah!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Well, fuck my ass and call me a bitch, I just got a letter!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: A letter from who, you shit sucking cock master?

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: It's from your mother.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: My mother sent YOU a letter? What's it say?

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: It says 'Dear Terrance, please don't ever tell my son that I licked your hairy balls.'

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: You'd fuck your uncle!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: YOU'D fuck your uncle!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Shut your fucking face, Unclefucka!! You're an asslicking, Ball sucking Unclefucka!! You're an Unclefucka, yes it's true Nobody fucks Uncles quite like you-

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: SHUT YOUR FUCKING FACE!! UNCLEFUCKA!!! YOU'RE the one that fucked your Uncle, UNCLEFUCKA!!! You don't eat, or sleep or mow the lawn You just fuck your Uncle all day long!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Well, Terrance I hope you learned something from this whole experience.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: I did, Terrance, I learned that you are a boner biting dick fart fuck face!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Say Phillip, want to see the Northern Lights?

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: You bet, Terrance!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: HA HA HA! You burned yourself to death by lighting the fart! HA HA HA!!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: I sure did, Phillip!!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Hello, Conan!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Hello, Brooke Shields!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Good one, Phillip!  Cheers.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Cheers, Terrance!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Phillip, we've been tricked and ambushed by The Conan O'Brian Show!!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: This little scrotum sucker willfully deceived us!  You are a bad man!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: And you call yourself a Canadian!  I told you we should of done Leno!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Fight the power!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: The young boy that died lit himself on fire. It was unfortunate, but how can they blame US?

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Don't believe the hype!!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: The problem is you don't allow your children to think for themselves. You try to raise them in a protective bubble, and then when they finally get old enough, they realize they've been lied to, and they resent you for it.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Yeah, God, no wonder your country is so fucked up.

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Oh, you are such a maroon!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: You would know, dummy.

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Oh, Phillip.  This cannot be good.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: I know, Terrance.  This is quite the shitstorm we've found ourselves in this time.

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Phillip, this is worse than that trip to Quebec City when I fell asleep in that disco.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: I know, Terrance. I know.

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: What's going on Terrance?

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Canada is saving us!!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Did you hear that, Terrance? I farted!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: You did? Just now?

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: AGH!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: Terrance! NO!

turns.speaker: PHILLIP
turns.text: You're quite a purveyor of filth, little boy!

turns.speaker: TERRANCE
turns.text: Indeedy, that was a delicious choice of words!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Oh, a new recruit, huh? Welcome to hell, kid! Relax! Take a load off!!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: You remember... Saddam Hussein, don't you?!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Saddam, would you let me do my job please!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey relax, guy. Let's see what the kid wants.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Well of COURSE he wants out of hell! The whole POINT of hell is that you don't WANT to be here!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Okay, kid, I have a deal for you! If you want out of hell, all you have to do is collect 10 proofs of purchases from 'Snacky Smores.'  They're rich, chocolatey and really hit the spot. Bring me ten proofs of purchases and we'll grant you ANY WISH YOU WANT.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I don't see why you have to belittle me in front of people like that.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey, relax guy. It's just a cruel joke. Rich, chocolatey Snacky Smores are only available up on Earth. He'll never get 'em, see?

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Sometimes I just think you don't have any respect for me.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey, come here, guy.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Who's my cream puff?

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: You just get cranky when you're tired, that's all.  I told you that you shouldn't have tried to carry that futon all by yourself.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I'm not cranky.  And that futon was not too big to carry myself-

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: It has come to be...  The Four Horsemen are drawing nigh!  The time of the prophecy is upon us!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Oh I love when you get all biblical Satan.  You know exactly how to turn my crank!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: No I'm being serious! Those Canadian entertainers are to be killed. It is the seventh sign.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Yeah!  YEAH!!!  Man I'm getting so HOT!!!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Do you always think about sex?  I'm talking about some very important stuff here!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Listen buttercup, let's make love and forget about the whole thing.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Is sex the only thing that matters to you?

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: You know I do.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: So what do you say we shut off that light and get close, huh?

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: What did you do today Satan?

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: You don't care.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey fella!  Relax!  This whole armageddon thing has got you all stressed out. Let's make love.

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Do you remember when you first got here? We used to talk all night long. Until the sun came up... We would just lie in bed and TALK.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: That's because I wanted to fuck you, dumbass! Now hows aboot you get those pants down!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Don't call me dumb!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: I mean cute dumb. Now bend over!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: This is the millennium, Saddam! This is Armageddon! There's more to life than sex!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey, relax guy!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Well I just want you to be impressed with what I <u>do</u>. I want you to respect my MIND.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: I DO respect your mind! It turns me on! It makes me wanna fuck the shit out of you! Don't you see?

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: What if I, don't wanna put out? That's all you ever say Relax put out I'm a living creature, I have feelings too, I don't need this abuse from you-

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey, guy, relax, put out! You gotta relax, shut your mouth- Baby I'd do anything for ya! Now don't make me smack you in the eye like last time-

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: What if I just left?

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Where're you gonna go, bitch? Besides, you know that if you left me, I'd hunt you down and kill you, right? I'm gonna go grab a drink.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Hey, I'm missing the party!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: No! It can't be!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I TOLD you not to make that deal, Saddam!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Who gives a fuck?! I was just fucking with him!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: No, Saddam. You made a deal. You can't just renege on a deal. That's lying.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Relax bitch!  You're better seen, not hear okay?

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Help you? You've destroyed my life and now you want me to help you?!  You're always making me feel like a piece of shit.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Come on guy, you know I only rib you because I love you so much!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: If you love somebody then you treat them with respect!  You've never respected me!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Can we talk about this later?  Everyone is watching!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: I don't care!  I want to talk about it now!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: Ow, you're hurting me!

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Listen guy, you're embarassing me in front of my friends!  You know how I get mad when I get embarassed.

turns.speaker: SADDAM HUSSEIN
turns.text: Now do what I say and keep your fucking mouth shut!

turns.speaker: SATAN
turns.text: THAT'S IT!  I HAVE HAD ENOUGH!!!!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: We saw the Terrance and Phillip movie!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: That's nice, Stan.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Did you see that, Wendy?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Didn't you think it was funny, Wendy?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Stan... I think you and I need some time apart.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: <u>WHAT?!</u>

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: This is about freedom of speech, Stan, about censorship.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about, kid?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: You don't get it Stan... You just don't get it.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Hi Wendy.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hi Stan.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: NAZIS!!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What's the matter, Wendy?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Nothing, Stan. You wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: God damn it, why does she keep saying that?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Wendy?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Stan?! YOU started La Resistance?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Stan! Stan are you okay?!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Wendy?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Wendy... How would you like to go get some ice cream?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Sure, Stan! How did you know I loved ice cream?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: My friend the clitoris told me.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Wow, I have a clitoris too.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Really? Where the hell do you keep it? It's huge.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Stan, I never cared for Gregory.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: You didn't?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: No, dude. Fuck him. Fuck him in the ear.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Cool!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Thank my lucky stars Here before me now Is everything I'd ever hoped for-

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Knew it in a word Saw it in a glance The only thing I think I'd die for

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: Bedrock!  I cannot dig any further in zis direction!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: We're going to die here like baby mice who have had no milk in days.  Dry up into crunchy little pinkies.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: You don't have watches?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Dude, you didn't say anything about watches.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: What do you think this is kid?  Lick Barney the Dinosaur's pussy fucking kiddie hour?  Huh?  This is real life with consequences you take to the grave!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: And ze rope?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Check.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: And the butfor?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh my God, what is he doing?

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: He's shutting off the air!!!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Will you two please stop it!  I don't want to spend my final hours listening to you bitch!

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: I'll tell you what I'm going to do.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Getting drunk is no solution.

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Yeah, well...I forgot my morphine back in the room.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I think we're moving.

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Well isn't that great.  Something to write home about.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I never though I'd be stuck in a wine closet with Warren Wayne.

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Well get used to it, 'cause here we are, on the cruise of a lifetime.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh Warren...oh Warren...take me, God take me...

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Oh yeah...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh yeah...

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Oh Sara...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Anna...

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Anna...

turns.speaker: WARREN
turns.text: Jesus, come on!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: They're not going to make it!

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Evening.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It can't be.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You're Warren Wayne.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Uh, yes I am.  And you are?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Anna Koros. She sensually extends her hand, Warren shakes it -

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Koros, as in...Koros?  Dimitri Koros?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: My grandfather.  My God, I can't tell you what a fan I am of yours! You were magnificent in Deadly Gamble.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Oh, thank you.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Magnificent, magnificent.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Well I appreciate that.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: So, what brings you out here?  Pleasure cruise?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Well a little business too.  In my upcoming project Star Trackers I play a ship's captain, and I really wanted to get a feel for the outer space experience.  I feel it will add more credibility to my performance.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Of course, of course...

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: So...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well I guess we're neighbors for this trip.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Well, so we are.  Sure is beautiful, huh?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It certainly is.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Well, it was nice meeting you. Enjoy the rest of the trip.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm sure I will.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: No, I think hygiene is important. It helps you get into the part.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Very professional of you.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Where the hell did you come from?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hello second mate Barnes. I was instructed to come to the bridge.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Weren't you down in the dining room?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I was there.  Officer Taylor accessed my CPU directly to open the airlock doors.  They are not functioning properly.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Oh he did, did he?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes he did.  Yes he did. Barnes looks at the monitor - Taylor and the others are still in the dining room -

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You didn't do anything to the monitors, did you Mac?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I did nothing to the monitors.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: And what are they doing now, Mac?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: They are awaiting further information.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Were you going to give it to them?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I am here to provide service to... to all our guests.  There is a high level of passenger dissatisfaction. It is my duty...to report this.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well you did the right thing Mac.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: On channel 10?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The device has stopped responding.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Mac, you really earned your wings this flight.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: My...wings...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I am here to provide service to... to all our guests.  There is a high level of passenger dissatisfaction. It is my duty...to report this.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I hear you Mac and I appreciate it. Frankly I don't know what I'd have done without you on this one.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: There is a high level...of passenger 					dissatisfaction.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: And I intend to correct that at once. I'll tell you something Mac...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Why should she, it's her fault. All guests are told not to eat in zero gravity, but she just wanted to have fun I guess, didn't realize what a grain of salt can do to sophisticated machinery.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Well, I guess she figures she's paying for it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ain't it the truth. Must be good to be rich.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What did you say to me?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's a little late for you to be up.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Look answer my question!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: All too well, captain.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Well shut it off at once!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well I guess there's no time like the present.  I'll go run a check on that room, just to show we go that extra mile for our guests.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Sounds like you've been talking to Mac too much.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: No, I just ran it!  Why are you running it again?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well it's a good thing that I did.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's telling me fail mode confirmed.  Did you see this?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: There must be some mistake. You sure you hit the right commands?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yes I'm sure I hit the right commands.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Why don't you reset and run it again.  The pods check out ok.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're certain of that?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Trust me.  Even checked 'em with my own eyes.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: All right, I'll give it a shot.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, everything's running smoother than a baby's ass.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ain't it the truth. The two say nothing for a beat -

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: So, are you on for the next one?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I don't know.  Everything's up in the air at this point, no pun intended.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Why, didn't they say?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well that hotel begins construction in January, there's going to be a lot of shuttle work.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You want to go back to shuttle work?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's steady, good benefits.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You gotta think of your old age.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That's very pragmatic of you, Barnes.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Man, I'm hungry.  I'm going to call the steward, you want anything?.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Nah, I already ate.  Why don't you just go down there?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What, and leave you here all by your lonesome?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I think I can handle it.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, maybe I will.  You sure you don't want anything?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: No.  I'm all set.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, maybe I'll surprise you.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I can hardly wait.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Bridge!  Can anyone hear me?!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah, give me a minute here.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: If anyone can hear me please respond!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: That's very professional sounding of you, Taylor.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Barnes, can you hear me, are you all right?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Why yes Ryan, I am, and thanks for asking.  You don't have to talk to the intercom, I can hear you fine.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What is the condition of the bridge?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The bridge is fine, Taylor, how are things down there?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Transmit the code 3 emergency and take us offline.  Override the airlock sensors and hurry!  We're running out of time, we have to get to the pods!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Much as I'd like to help you and our valued guests, I'm afraid I can't.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What are you talking about! Can you transmit the code 3 -

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yes I can transmit the code 3 emergency!  I just don't think it's a prudent move at this juncture.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Now do you want the good news first or the bad news?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You better start making sense!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ok, I will.  The bad news is the ship is history.  Life support will last another 36 hours, maybe.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Then we've got to get to the lifepods!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'd advise you to shut up and let me finish Taylor.  You needn't worry about the lifepods because they're all gone, jettisoned. Save for one.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's still not going to work! They'll detect you upon re-entry in an emergency vessel!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Who said I'll re-enter in the pod? I got friends out in space, Ryan, friends willing to get me back unnoticed.  Thank God for deregulation huh?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Uh, that's an affirmative, Roger Wilco.  Please proceed.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: We have the codes here.  How do you want to receive them?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well, preferably in tens and twenties...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: That was a joke Taylor, lighten up!  Why don't you just hold them up to the lens.  I'll write them down, and once I'm through verifying them, I'll get back to you.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Will you transmit the distress signal?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Mac, can you hear me?  Come in?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Taylor, you surprise me.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Sure you do.  Sending Mac out on a little recon work.  How pathetic.  Problem is it seems Mac blew a few fuses.  Or maybe he's just a little drunk. Were you partying with a robot Taylor?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Look we gave you what you asked for.  It checks out didn't it?! What more do you want from us!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I told you not to try anything smart!  I guess you're too much of a maverick to follow a simple order!  And that's just too bad for all of you now, isn't it?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Look you said it doesn't matter to you anyway!  Why do you want to kill more innocent people!  Why!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Idiot...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Good help is hard to find...

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Barnes?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: That's me.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Break it down to me, what's going on?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Seems like they're cooperating. Hopefully I'll be out of here and on my way very soon.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well don't drag your ass.  There won't be much of a window for us to link up.  We'll be in your orbit trajectory in less than two hours.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeah, I know Bill, I came up with the plan remember?  Just have those hangar doors open and ready, I can take it from there.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Will do.  What about the distress signal?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I don't know.  I really haven't made up my mind yet.  We'll see how nicely they behave.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well that's your call.  Doesn't make a damn bit of difference to me.  Just as long as I get my cut.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Oh you'll get it, believe me.  So I'll see you in a few.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: 10-4 good buddy.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: It's time we lock coordinates.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I know, I know.
